page.title: 03ECOLOGY IN FORDYCE AREA
page.content:
- FORDYCE BURN -
The source of Fordyce Burn is between Greenhill Plantation and Cottonhill, at 150 metres above sea level.The average depth of the burn is 27cm, width 2.6 metres.Its total length is 29km.Beside the Burn we found Red Dead Nettle, Dandelion, Dock, Couchgrass, Buttercup, Daisy, Comfrey,Lesser Celandine, Thistle, Moss, Marsh Marigold, Speedwell, Goosegrass, Nettle, Bishopweed, Cow Parsley and Ivy.In the Burn were Mayfly Larvae, Water Spiders and Snails. Frog Spawn and Cadis Fly Larvae is common. At times the Burn is polluted by waste from a piggery and farms. This kills wildlife but Sewage works at Fordyce pump fresh water into the burn which flows through farmlands to reach the coast at Glassaugh.
